column4: anyone here with a amd/ati radeon card? thinking of switching from nvidia to a radeon 4850, need to know whats the quality and stability of the radeon closed source drivers.. also how well dual view is implemented? i have two displays, a 24" and a 22" tft lcd, to connect to the card
Yes, I can help you with that

You should know that AMD released the specification for almost all the ATI-model cards, earlier this year, and there are Free Software drivers being written for them at a furious pace.  You can already try out the developer versions of these open drivers, and the drivers for R500 chips and older will be built into the next version of Ubuntu
but do there drivers support 4850/70? and if they dont, or they need more polish, how well closed source amdati drivers work?
Yes the drivers will support the 4850/70 cards, although efforts appear to be starting with earlier released cards.  The closed drivers are notoriously poor, on the other hand.
as i see it not even the closed source drivers support 4850/70
so i guess i should hold off the purchase
I purchased a 3650 and I found it difficult to get dual monitors working with the closed drivers.  The open drivers had no problems, but there is no 3D support for R600 chips, yet.
got some link of the website of ati oss drivers?
nm, i found it
http://wiki.x.org/wiki/RadeonFeature ; http://www.phoronix.com/forums/showthread.php?s=844e52238b85865d489a98d68b85e322&t=9951
seems theres support for 4850/70 in catalyst 8.6 linux drivers http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=article&item=amd_catalyst_86&num=1
The closed drivers do seem to be ready from AMD, from that link information.
think i am getting it... 4850 for 150 euro here
Plus, you can know there will be open drivers coming in the near future.
yeah, i suppose we can count on it
if only they had some uvd support out, i would yank that 6600gt out of the htpc in no time
I upgraded from a 6600GT with dual monitors.  The open R600 works for me fine, even without yet having the 3D support
yeah, i mean if ati had h264/vc1 gpu accelerated decoding out
but i suppose they'll do it, sooner than nvidia at least
